isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - ROCKWELL TANDEM AXLE FORWARD REAR DRIVE UNITS - INSTALL

svcproc.title: Main Differential Case and Ring Gear Assembly Into the Carrier

note.para: The bearing cones are not interchangeable.

warning.para: Observe all warnings and cautions concerning press operation to avoid serious personal injury and possible damage to components.

step1.para: If the bearing cones on the main differential case were removed, install a new cone and cup in a set from the same manufacturer. Use a press and a sleeve to install the cones on the case. Press only on the inner race of the bearing ( Figure 120).
Clean and dry the bearing cups and bores of the carrier legs and bearing caps.
Lubricate the bearing cups and cones with the same axle lubricant used in the axle housing. Refer to GROUP 10 - LUBRICATION in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.
Apply Rockwell Adhesive 2297-T-4180 or Loctite 609 evenly in the bearing bores of the carrier legs and bearing caps. Cover surfaces completely.
Install the cups over the bearing cones.
Safely lift the main differential case and ring gear assembly and install in the carrier. The bearing cups MUST be flat against the bores between the carrier legs ( Figure 121).

figure.caption: Figure 121. Install Main Differential Case and Ring Gear Assembly

step1.para: Install both of the bearing adjusting rings into position between the carrier legs. Turn each adjusting ring hand-tight against the bearing cup ( Figure 122).
Install the bearing caps over the bearings and adjusting rings in the location marked before removal ( Figure 123).

caution.para: The bearing caps must be properly installed or the adjusting rings will be damaged by cross-threading. Forcing the caps into position can damage the caps and the carrier housing.

warning.para: Wear safe eye protection. Do not hit steel parts with a steel hammer. Parts can break and cause serious personal injury.

figure.caption: Figure 123. Install Bearing Caps and Adjusting Rings

step1.para: Tap each bearing cap into position with a light plastic or rubber mallet. The caps MUST fit easily against the bearings, adjusting rings and carrier. DO NOT FORCE THE BEARING CAPS INTO POSITION.

note.para: The lock pins for the adjusting rings are installed after the tooth contact pattern is checked.

step1.para: Install the bolts and washers that hold the bearing caps to the carrier. Tighten the bolts to the correct torque value. Refer to the Torque Chart.
